abstract: Bank of America closed its acquisition of Merrill Lynch on Thursday, one day after Wells Fargo finished buying Wachovia.
snippet: Bank of America closed its acquisition of Merrill Lynch on Thursday, one day after Wells Fargo finished buying Wachovia.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America closed its acquisition of Merrill Lynch on Thursday, ending more than 94 years of independence for the Wall Street investment bank and brokerage firm. One day earlier, Wells Fargo finished buying Wachovia, completing another deal born from the turmoil that has transformed the banking industry in the United States.
